text.p: Slovakia's sole crude oil refiner Slovnaft a.s. said on Tuesday it had signed a contract worth about $130 million with U.S. firm Raytheon Engineers and Constructors to upgrade its Bratislava refinery.
The contract is for the turnkey delivery of production units for a fluid catcracker, alkylation, selective hydrogenation of C4 fractions and an MTBE production unit, Slovnaft said in a statement.

"Slovnaft's technology will be enhanced by a further cracking plant which will upgrade crude oil processing with a significant economic and ecological effect, mainly by a production increase in high quality petrol," it said.
It added that the contract was one of the largest within Slovnaft's major heavy residue process ugrading project, Environmental Fuel Project Apollo (EFPA), expected to be completed in early 1999.
Slovnaft refined 5.1 million tonnes of crude oil last year, and it said it expected to process about the same volume this year. -- Tatiana Vacova, Bratislava Newsroom, 42-7-210-3687
